intro: Tripudianthes viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered balsam, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, branched stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. The flowers are clustered in racemes and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
